meanings.definition: To fill (a container) again with liquid.
meanings.sent1: After drinking all the water, I need to refill my bottle.
meanings.sent2: I always refill my coffee cup in the morning.
meanings.sent3: The thirsty plant begged me to refill its water supply.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to refill the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The chef hurried to refill the empty soup pot before the dinner rush.

meanings.definition: An act of filling something again.
meanings.sent1: I asked for a refill of my drink at the restaurant.
meanings.sent2: The refill of ink for my pen was expensive.
meanings.sent3: The refill of popcorn at the movies was a bargain.
meanings.sent4: The refill of sunshine after the storm was a welcome sight.
meanings.sent5: The refill of love in their relationship brought them closer together.
